meanings.sent1: During the winter, the dearths of fresh fruits and vegetables made it hard to eat healthy.
meanings.sent2: The dearths of water in the desert caused great hardship for the animals living there.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a dearth-fest when we realized we forgot to bring any food.
meanings.sent4: In the land of plenty, the sudden dearths of kindness were deeply felt by all.
meanings.sent5: The dearth of stars in the city sky made stargazing impossible.

meanings.definition: A lack or shortage of something
meanings.sent1: The dearths of pencils in the classroom led to students sharing one pencil for the whole day.
meanings.sent2: The dearths of volunteers made it challenging to organize the charity event.
meanings.sent3: The dearth of laughter in the comedy club was quite ironic.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright light in the dearth of happiness around her.
meanings.sent5: The dearth of colors in the painting gave it a unique, minimalist beauty.
